content.2. Course Description: This course expands upon basic nutrition concepts by exploring the unique nutritional needs for physical activity and athletic performance. In addition to, gaining knowledge of the proper dietary habits in connection to physical activity or sport-specific training to support health, energy, and adaptations.
content.3. Pre-requisites: FNU 216 Nutrition through Lifecycle FNU 311 Macro-Nutrient Metabolism
content.5. Course Main Objectives: The purpose of this course is to provide students with a comprehensive knowledge about nutrition in relation to sports training and performance. The course will teach students the fundamentals of nutrient requirements for a variety of physical activities, including endurance, strength, speed, and weight control. The evaluation of dietary supplements and ergogenic aids will also be addressed.

1.0 Knowledge and understanding.Course Learning Outcome: Determine the appropriate nutrition for physical activity individual and athletes.
Recognize the sources of energy used in exercise and metabolism.
Describe the sources of energy and the energy expenditure

2.0 Skills.Course Learning Outcome: Assess the nutritional needs for a variety of physical activities.
Formulate an appropriate diet plan for physical activity individual and athletes to improve

topics.topic:
Recommended intake of nutrients for physical activity individual and athletes
(Carbohydrates, proteins, fats, minerals, and vitamins)
Review Fuel sources for muscle and exercise metabolism

Energy: energetic efficiency, measuring the energy content in food, energy
balance, and energy expenditure.

Gastric emptying, digestion, and absorption. Regulation of gastrointestinal
tract, gastrointestinal tract problems during and after exercise.

Meal planning and Weight management for physical activity individual and
athletes
Nutrition for endurance and ultra-endurance training
Electrolytes and Supplement and ergogenic Aids

Example of special Nutrition needs (disability, children, pregnant women, and
Vegetation athletes)

Essential References: Jeukendrup Asker & Gleeson Micheal (2019), Sport Nutrition 3rd Ed. Human Kinetics
Supportive References: Lanham-New, S. A., Stear, S. J., Shirreffs, S. M., and Colllins, A. L. (2011), Sport and Exercise nutrition. First edition. Wiley-Blackwell.
Electronic Materials: Nutrition for Health, Fitness & Sport 10th edition. 2012. M.H. Williams, D.E. Anderson and E.S. Rawson
